edu.gmu.cs332.hw5
Class Config

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.gmu.cs332.hw5.Config
public class Config
extends java.lang.Object

Config is a singleton class that stores configuration information in key/value string pairs. Configuration can either be set each property at a time or loaded all at once via an input stream.

Author:
Tim Cheadle

Method Detail

getInstance

public static Config getInstance()
The common interface through which to access the singleton Config object. This method will create a Config object the first time it's called and refer to that same object any other time its called.

Returns:
The singleton instance

load

public void load(java.io.InputStream input)
          throws java.io.IOException
Loads a set of properties from an input stream.

Parameters:
input - The input stream containing key/value pairs
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurred while reading from the input stream
